com.eis.greenenergy.main

Class DetailActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • com.eis.greenenergy.main.DetailActivity

  • public class DetailActivity
extends Activity
    Class to display and control the detail view of the application.
    This view includes a ListView with the next 10 hourly energy data predictions, as well as the display of the user's data. If the user already granted the authority to access his Twitter account, the ImageButton for tweeting is also displayed.
    Since:
    2014-06-14
    Version:
    2.1
    Author:
    Veronika Henk, Sarvenaz Golchin, Mahnaz Hajibaba

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  DetailActivity.CustomAdapter
      Inner class to maintain a ListView with single choice mode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DetailActivity

        public DetailActivity()

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Initiates the activity layout, checks for a network connection, and initiates the UserManager object.
        In detail, the corresponding layout file is assigned in this method. Moreover, this method checks if the device has access to a network connection by creating an instance of the auxiliary class AlertDialogManager.
        By creating an instance of the class UserManager this method tries to access the user's data. If the user's data is retrieved successfully, the method initGUI which builds the actual layout is called; otherwise this activity itself is finished and MainActivity is restored and subsequently redirects to LoginActivity.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Saved information about each View object in this activity's layout, to enable restoring this state if the activity instance is destroyed and recreated.

      • onResume

        protected void onResume()
        Calls the method to initiate the activity layout if the user is logged in, or finishes this activity otherwise.
        Moreover, this method creates a new instance of UserManager when the activity is restored and checks if the user is logged in. If the user is logged in, the user data is displayed along with the activity's layout.

      • initGUI

        private void initGUI()
        Sets the actual layout for this activity.
        In detail, the individual layout elements are initialized and text is assigned to the text views. Moreover an instance of SharedPreferences is initialized, as well. The current point in time is obtained in order to retrieve the current amount of green energy calling the method accessdata().
        Using the method isTwitterLoggedInAlready(), the twitter button becomes invisible if the user is not logged into Twitter already; otherwise the behavior of the twitter button is implemented by setting up the onClick() method.
        Furthermore the current point of time is requested and predictions for the next 10 hours are retrieved, calling the method getPredictions() from the instance of UserManager. The method displayListView() is called in order to construct the list view with its entries and display it on the screen.

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
        Initiates the menu initialization when an instance of the activity is created.
        Moreover the menu is inflated when this method is called and the items defined in this method are added. So far we only have one item, which is the logout function.
        Parameters:
        menu - The menu of this activity.
        Returns:
        true if the menu was inflated successfully;
        false otherwise.

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Defines the actions to be done when an item in the menu is selected.
        So far we only have one menu entry, which has the purpose to trigger the user's logout. Therefore if this item is selected, the method logout() which is also defined in this activity, is called.
        Parameters:
        item - Menu entry which was selected.
        Returns:
        true if the selected item was identified successfully and according actions could be initiated;
        false otherwise.

      • displayListView

        private void displayListView()
        Constructs the list view to show predictions for the next 10 hours to the user.
        In this method the current point in time is retrieved in order to get predictions for the next 10 hours calling the method getPredictions(). The formatted amount of green energy for every prediction is stored in the array predictions, the corresponding color for each entry in the list view is stored in the array colors. Furthermore the unformatted amount of green energy is stored in the array amounts; it is necessary to calculate the score which the user will get if he activates a notification.
        Moreover the list arraylist of the type PredictionEntry is created and gets filled with the data which should be displayed in the ListView. The ListView predictionList gets connected to the data contained in arraylist using an instance of the inner class CustomAdapter in order to display predictionList to the user.

      • logout

        private void logout()
        Conducts the user's logout from the application as well as from Twitter.
        Moreover to log the user out from the application, the login-data is deleted from his device. To log out from Twitter the instance of SharedPreferences is edited and the Twitter Api keys are removed from it. As the user is not supposed to see this view, when he is not logged in, this activity is finished. As this activity is always called from MainActivity, this is restored and then automatically forwards to LoginActivity.

      • createNotification

        public Notification createNotification(int delay,
                              double amount)
        Creates a notification and activates an instance of AlarmManager in order to push the notification at a particular time.
        This method creates an instance of PendingIntent in order to enable pushing the notification, as well as an instance of Intent in order to call the class MainActivity when the user tabs on the notification. The notification is constructed by using an instance of NotificationCompat.Builder. By using this class the compatibility of this method with all Android versions is ascertained.
        Moreover, this method creates another intent in order to call the auxiliary class NotificationPublisher using the above mentioned instance of AlarmManager. When activating the instance of AlarmManager the delay until the notification shows up is defined in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        amount - Predicted amount of green energy, necessary to calculate the increment of the user's score.
        delay - Amount of milliseconds until the notification is pushed.
        Returns:
        Notification which was created in this method because it is necessary in case the alarm gets canceled.

      • cancelNotification

        public void cancelNotification(Notification notification)
        Cancels the notification passed as parameter.
        Moreover this method creates another intent which equals the intent (has the same extras) which was used to set the alarm. By doing so the initially created alarm gets overwritten, then the newly created alarm is canceled. This proceeding is necessary as we cannot access the alarm which was created in another method.
        Parameters:
        notification - Instance of Notification which is supposed to be canceled.
